website_summaries.verdict: A recent soundbar model with clear, high-quality sound, voice control, and a sleek design.
pros: Sleek, slim model comes with voice assistance that can track your commands through music
Pairs easily with other Bose speakers
Connects to devices through Bluetooth and WiFi, including music apps
cons: Only comes with basic Bose remote

customer_reviews.title: TV Settings are the Key to Set-up!
customer_reviews.text: If it weren't for an online troubleshooting video (not a Bose video) we'd still be stumped. The Bose Music app is essential but incomplete. One must make adjustments to ones TV settings. Besides turning off the television speakers and making audio adjustments (PCM, variable) one must also enable the CEC setting in order to turn on the HDMI ARC feature. Without that, the soundbar will play music but there won't be a peep from the TV. Also enable the Alexa app to detect the soundbar. Honestly, Bose, how much ink would it take to put those key points in the nearly blank instructions? It now works great but what frustration.
customer_reviews.author: PJM

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I have used Bose all my life. I have a 2009 Bose Lifestyle V20 and a 2019 Accoustimass 10 V series. Maybe It's just the room but this product blew my mind. I bought this for a large bedroom with the add-on surround speakers. With the surround speakers it sounds better than my 2019 Bose Accoustimass. I am glad I didnt buy the Bose Soundbar 700 for a large bedroom. This product will impress in ANY moderate sized room.
customer_reviews.author: Blake32

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound, horrible mic for Alexa.
customer_reviews.text: Of coarse you get that premium sound expected from Bose. The mic is terrible, either it doesn’t respond or doesn’t respond correctly to your commands. A+ on sound D- on the mic. Save your money, just get a plain Bose sound bar, and an Echo dot, it will save you the frustration of yelling at the sound, in hopes that this time it just may hear you.
customer_reviews.author: Movie Expert Squared

customer_reviews.title: good sound for small space
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of this soundbar. It was easy to set up. I have a very small living room and this really sounds great. I like the ease of the app to adjust bass, etc. I really chose this because it also included Alexa, but that is also was the down side I experienced: Alexa quit after one week. After going through every troubleshooting step, I found the thing that did work (so far) is unplugging the soundbar for 30 second and Voila! Alexa!
customer_reviews.author: PA djk

customer_reviews.title: Can’t see.
customer_reviews.text: What I don’t like is that for $500 the remote does not light up....seriously? What a sloppy shortcut to cheapen an otherwise decent product. The sound is decent enough, but not surround sound quality. I haven’t yet used the Alexa feature.....gotta figure that out...
customer_reviews.author: Edward White

customer_reviews.title: Come into 21st century, Bose
customer_reviews.text: As always, superior sound quality and spatial ambience with exceptional build quality and design. The remote, for a $500 product, is abysmal. Very faint button labeling with non-intuitive lay out. It continually ‘forgets’ station presets. The smart phone app is ridiculously poorly designed. Again, non-intuitive and it uses a light gray on white background. Does Bose think that color coding settings is not millennial cool? The app periodically requires re-login after apologizing for logging you off. BTW when introduced two years previously, prospective buyers were told that Siri integration was imminent. As of last firmware upgrade two weeks ago it has not been implemented.
customer_reviews.author: Octopusrex

customer_reviews.title: Best sound bar you can buy on a budget

I am a firm believer that sound is more important than the TV screen quality itself. Just make sure the TV is equipped with Dolby Audio (or similar) for the best experience. It puts you into the action. The only complaint I have is that the remote sometimes experiences delays when I turn it on and off/change the input.

product_meta.title: Bose Soundbar 500 with Alexa voice control built-in, Black
product_meta.description: Style:Soundbar| Color:BlackThe Bose sound bar 500 is meant to be heard, not seen. It fits discreetly under your TV screen, so you won’t even know it’s there — until you hear it. Built-in voice assistants, like Alexa and the Google assistant, let you enjoy millions of songs, internet radio stations, playlists, and more — hands free. Experience superior voice pickup from a custom-designed eight-microphone array that will still hear you even over loud music.
feature_bullets: Designed slim and engineered powerful for a better sound experience that won't get in the way of your TV screen
Built in voice assistants, like Alexa and the Google Assistant, with superior voice pickup from a noise rejecting eight microphone Array
With Wi Fi, Bluetooth, and Apple airplay 2 compatibility, you can wirelessly stream whatever you want, however you want
Control comes easy with three different ways to manage what you hear: voice, Bose music app, or included remote
Add the optional Bose bass Module and Bose Surround Speakers to feel the impact of thunderous bass and full on surround sound
Bose SimpleSync technology allows you to pair your Bose Soundbar 500 or 700 with Bose Noise Cancelling Headphones 700 for a personal listening experience
Play integrated music services like Spotify, music and audible through Bluetooth or Wi Fi connections
Simple Bose music app driven setup with detailed prompts ; Supported audio format: Dolby Digital, DTS; Video source compatibility: HDMI
